[microformats][0] are the simplest way to openly publish contacts, events,reviews, recipes, and other structured information on the web. >>> import mf >>> url = "https://alice.example" >>> doc = f''' ...

Alice

...
    ...
  • foo ...
  • bar ...
... ''' >>> page = mf.parse(doc=doc, url=url) # TODO >>> dict(page) # TODO >>> page.json >>> card = page["items"][0] >>> card["type"] ['h-card'] >>> card["properties"] {'name': ['Alice'], 'url': ['https://alice.example']} >>> feed = page["items"][1] >>> feed["children"][0]["properties"]["name"] ['foo'] >>> mf.util.representative_card(page, url) {'name': ['Alice'], 'url': ['https://alice.example']} >>> mf.util.representative_feed(page, url)["items"][0]["name"] ['foo'] # TODO >>> page.representative_card # TODO {'name': ['Alice'], 'url': ['https://alice.example']} # TODO >>> page.representative_feed["items"][0]["name"] # TODO ['foo']Based upon [`mf2py`][1] and [`mf2util`][2].[0]: https://microformats.org/wiki/microformats[1]: https://github.com/microformats/mf2py[2]: https://github.com/kylewm/mf2util
